intro: Rhexia quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-angle rhexia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and have a quadrangular shape, giving it its common name. Rhexia quadrangularis is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
